column4: Hey guys some halp pl0x ;) How to install a live version of ubuntu onto a portable hardrive, then create a writeable partition on it, so the live ubuntu can write onto it?
you could make the HD be a linux filesystem such as ext3, install grub2. and have grub2 boot a ubuntu ISO file as one way.
thers also guides at pendrivelinux.com on making a 'casper' save file on a usb drive/live install.
